originalText.text:
We are part of the Small door family for more than 1,5 year and we are really satisfied with the whole team either from Gramercy or West Village!
My dog Alfred is always super happy to come visit even when he‚Äôs really not feeling well‚Ä¶ so that‚Äôs always a good sign!
And the chat service 24/7 is a huge +++
Thanks for everything

originalText.text: Great vet experience. I like being able to book appointments on the app and get 24/7 nurse support. The people I've met have been very caring of me and my dog. They are thorough and also provide price information up front, and file with pet insurance on your behalf if you have that.

text.text: Great vet experience. I like being able to book appointments on the app and get 24/7 nurse support. The people I've met have been very caring of me and my dog. They are thorough and also provide price information up front, and file with pet insurance on your behalf if you have that.

originalText.text: I started going to the Small Door Williamsburg location because it is close to my home. I noticed my concerns were dismissed and ignored, so I started looking for another provider outside the organization. In the interim, we were referred to the West Village (WV) Location for an exam, and it was like night and day. Since then, we have decided to continue our dog's care at WV with Dr. Rogers and the fantastic staff at WV, who I can't say enough how amazing they are. Dr. Rogers goes over and beyond when addressing my concerns, as little as they are, regarding my furmonster's care. I truly appreciate that she takes the time to inform me of what's going on with my JuJu, and I love her compassion and care. Words are not enough to describe how amazing she is as a provider and how excellent and patient her staff is when dealing with my stubborn husky mix.

originalText.text:
I recently adopted a dog through a rescue called
Hearts&bones.
I adopted my girly Molly, and through hearts and bones I was informed about
Small door veterinary.
I remember growing up with pets and bringing them to the vet, it was NOT a pleasant experience, but small door‚Ä¶ completely revolutionary
My daughter even enjoyed it, we sat in the waiting room no longer than 5 mins, we than entered the room and we sat on a comfy couch as our girl roamed around the room, the vet gave her a few treats, she was Not stressed at all
Which was my main concern as a rescue dog she‚Äôs more skittish than most, but she stood still as they examined her. She also received some vaccines
And her preventives were given to me to start her on the first of April.
I didn‚Äôt pay for any of the vaccines or preventatives because I have the Premuim plus plan,
Which covers that and so much more.
Everyone was friendly
And chill.. I love how clean and minimal this place is and you have access to all locations
So that‚Äôs a plus too.
If you want a stress free, friendly experience with your fur baby, I really recommend small doorü•∞

originalText.text: ***** AMAZING ***** Mistakenly made a morning appointment for the wrong day for my dog with an infection.    The entire staff (reception, medical assistants and doctor) could not have been nicer or more accommodating.   They were able to find room in their busy calendar to evaluate and care for Elsa.  The entire experience was completely different than any other NYC veterinarian visit.  Clean, friendly, caring, professional and amazing communications!!!!  I would highly recommend Small Door without hesitation.   Thanks again!  üôè
